main event: A bright light, changing from red to white, was observed traveling very high and very fast over Piedmont, Missouri on October 23, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed by ground-radar for 15 minutes.
The object's course and number of objects were unknown.
The report states there was insufficient information for evaluation.
The report mentions the use of infrared information and binoculars in the investigation.
The report includes angular measurements and compass bearings related to the sighting.
sighted object: a bright light, changing from red to white
